concept.title: Handling Problems in the Provisioning Process

section.p: If the provisioning or modificationprovisioning or modificationprovisioningprovisioningprovisioningprovisioning of a virtual servervirtual systemvirtual systemvirtual systemVMvirtual resources fails on the AWSROROpenStackTPS5vSphereAzure side or if there are problems in the communication between the participating systems, the corresponding subscription in remains pending. The AWSROROpenStackTPS5VMwareAzure service controller informs the technology managers of its responsible technology provider organization by email of any incomplete provisioning, modification, or deleteprovisioning, modification, or deleteprovisioning or deleteprovisioning or deleteprovisioning or delete operation in AWSROROpenStackTPS5vSphereAzure.

You can then take the appropriate actions to solve the problem in AWSROROpenStackTPS5vSphereAzure or in the communication. For example, you could remove an incomplete virtual servervirtual platform or servervirtual systemvirtual platformVMvirtual machine, or you could restore a missing connection.

After solving the problem, the AWSROROpenStackTPS5vSphereAzure integration components and need to be synchronized accordingly. You do this by triggering a corresponding action in the APP component. Proceed as follows:

ol.li: Work as a technology manager of the technology provider organization responsible for the AWSROROpenStackTPS5VMwareAzure service controller.

Invoke the instance status interface of APP for the AWSROROpenStackTPS5VMwareAzure service controller by opening the following URL in a Web browser:
https://<server>:<port>/oscm-app/controller/?cid=ess.rorawsopenstacktps5vmwareazureARM
For example:
https://127.0.0.1:8881/oscm-app/controller/?cid=ess.rorawsopenstacktps5vmwareazureARM
The Web page shows all subscriptions for AWSROROpenStackTPS5VMsAzure, including detailed information such as the customer organization, the ID of the related AWSROROpenStackTPS5VMAzure instance, and the provisioning status.

Find the subscription for which you solved the problem in the most recent provisioning, modification, or deleteprovisioning or deleteprovisioning or deleteprovisioning, modification, or deleteprovisioning, modification, or deleteprovisioning or delete operation.

In the Action column, select the action for the AWSROROpenStackTPS5vSphereAzure integration components to execute next. Possible actions are the following:
RESUME - to resume the processing of a provisioning operation in APP which was suspended.
SUSPEND - to suspend the processing of a provisioning operation in APP, for example, when AWSROROpenStackTPS5vSphereAzure does not respond.
UNLOCK - to remove the lock for an AWSan RORan OpenStacka TPS5a VMan Azure instance in APP.
DELETE - to terminate the subscription in and remove the instance in APP, but keep the virtual platform or servervirtual servervirtual systemvirtual platformVMresources in AWSROROpenStackTPS5vSphereAzure for later use. The service manager role is required for this action.
DEPROVISION - to terminate the subscription in , remove the instance in APP, and delete the virtual platform or servervirtual servervirtual systemvirtual platformVMresources in AWSROROpenStackTPS5vSphereAzure. The service manager role is required for this action.
ABORT_PENDING - to abort a pending provisioning or modification operationprovisioning operationprovisioning operationprovisioning or modification operationprovisioning or modification operationprovisioning operation in . is notified to roll back the changes made for the subscription and return it to its previous state. In AWSOpenStackRORTPS5vSphereAzure, no actions are carried out.
COMPLETE_PENDING - to complete a pending provisioning or modification operationprovisioning operationprovisioning operationprovisioning or modification operationprovisioning or modification operationprovisioning operation in . is notified to complete the changes for the subscription and set the subscription status to ready (or suspended if it was suspended before). This is possible only if the operations of the service controller are already completed.
Click Execute to invoke the selected action.

section.p: The instance status interface provides the following additional functionality that is useful for problem-solving purposes:

ul.li: You can display service instance details for each subscription by clicking the corresponding entry in the table. This displays all subscription-related information that is stored in the bssapp database.

The Run with timer column indicates whether the timer for the interval at which APP polls the status of instances is running. You can reset the timer, if required. For details on the timer setting, refer to .
